intro: Striga gracillima, commonly known as the slender witchweed, is a parasitic flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and lacks chlorophyll, relying entirely on host plants for nutrients. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers and has a short life cycle, often completing its development within a few weeks. Its parasitic nature makes it a significant agricultural pest, particularly in cereal crops. Striga gracillima is also notable for its ability to produce large numbers of seeds, contributing to its invasive potential in affected regions.
